mechanoreception.notes: As demosponges, they likely possess some form of mechanoreception to detect water currents and particle movement, but specific mechanisms are unknown.

chemoreception.notes: Likely present for detecting chemical cues in the water, aiding in feeding and other biological processes. Details of the specific receptors are unknown.

photoreception.notes: No evidence suggests photoreception in this family. Demosponges in general lack specialized photoreceptor cells, although some indirect light sensitivity might be present.
